Галину хорошо знают в селе, она всегда добросовестно работает и отвечает за качество выполненных работ. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 5 лет. Раньше Галина работала в Москве на строительстве и ремонте квартир, но потом заболела и, к тому же, у нее умерли родители, пришлось искать какой-то заработок у себя на родине. Доход от плетения составляет 2 700 гривен. 

Галине необходим кредит для личных нужд: она хочет оформить документы на дом, который ее семья получила в наследство от родителей мужа. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Galina, her husband, and their two children live in the rural town of Gorinchevo, in Khust.  She earns her living weaving wicker, making breadboxes, wreaths, flower-vases, baskets and other handmade items.  She is well known in town for always doing a conscientious job and providing quality work.  She's been in business for five years.  She previously worked in Moscow in construction, renovating apartments, but then she got sick, plus her parents passed away so she came back home to look for some kind of work.  The wickerwork brings in an income of 2700 UAH.

Galina is seeking a loan for personal use: she wants to finalize the paperwork on the house the family inherited from her husband's parents.

loans.use: to complete documentation on her house, which her family inherited from her in-laws.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 32-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his parents. His father works hard to pay the family's expenses, and since 2006 Haytham has helped by installing air conditioners on a freelance basis.  He is applying for a $3,000 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy air conditioners and more of the tools he needs to install them. He believes this loan will help him attract more customers. In the future, he plans to open an electronics shop.

loans.use: to buy air conditioners and more tools.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Саид занимается торговлей запчастей телефонов. Кроме того он занимается пополнением счетов телефонов. В этой области он уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения телефонов и запасных частей телефонов.
texts.en: Said lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 31 years old, married and has two children.  Said is involved in selling spare parts for phones.  Besides this, he is also involved in refilling phone accounts.  He has been in this business for three years.  Said is requesting this loan for the purchase of phones and spare parts for phones.

loans.use: to purchase phones and spare parts for phones

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 46-year-old Lebanese man. He’s divorced and living on his own. Ali is working really hard to improve his life so he can spend the rest of it in a proper way. He has been working in the construction field since 1995, and knows very well how to please and satisfy his clients. 

Today, he’s requesting a loan of $2,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new construction supplies and also wood. He notes that this will enhance his work and allow him take on bigger projects. In the future, he plans to develop his business further and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to purchase new construction supplies and also wood.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. With his wife’s support, he is able to cover his family's expenses and pay his children’s educational fees.  Naser has owned a spice shop in his town since 2006. He also has a small corner in his shop where he sells herbal beauty products. As for his wife, she has been teaching in a local school for the past nine years.  

Today, Naser is requesting to borrow $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional spices and herbal cosmetics in order to develop his business. This Kiva loan will allow him to earn a superior income. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and improve his work.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices and herbal cosmetics.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 48 años de edad está casado hace 24 años  con la señora Fermina de 44 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 19. 12 y 6 años.
El Sr. Miguel tiene una despensa bien surtida. El se dedica a esto hace 17 años, después de casarse se fue a trabajar en al extranjero,  pudo juntar un poco de dinero y a su vuelta al país pudo  empezar  su negocio que es administrado por su señora. Él desde hace un tiempo atrás formó otro negocio con su hermano en otro local donde comercializa materiales de construcción y  gracias a estos ingresos que tiene pueden costear el estudio de sus hijos, pues su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan una profesión.                                                                   Solicita este préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, harina, yerba, jabón, golosinas en general, bebidas, vino y demás, con lo cual podrá tener bien surtido su negocio y de esa forma mantener su clinentela.
texts.en:
Miguel, 48, has been married for 24 years to Fermina, 44.  The couple has four children, ages 23, 19, 12, and 6.

Miguel has a well-stocked store.  He has worked at this for 17 years.  After he got married he went abroad to work.  He managed to get together a little bit of money and upon returning to his country was able to start his business, which is run by his wife.  Some time ago he set up another business with his brother in another place where he sells construction materials.  Thanks to these incomes that he has they can pay for their children's studies, since his biggest dream is for his children to be professionals and have careers.

He is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, yerba mate, soap, general candy, beverages, wine, and other products with which he will be able to stock his business well and so keep his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, yerba mate, soap, candy, etc.

loans.name: Cinthia Carolina

texts.es: Cinthia Carolina es una emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de cosmético, en el cual ella ya tiene establecidos sus clientes fijos y eventuales que la visitan en su negocio, también Cinthia realiza visitas a sus clientes de forma ambulante ya que así ha aumentado sus clientes. Cinthia Carolina está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de variedad de cosméticos.
texts.en: Cinthia Carolina is an entrepreneur who sells cosmetics. She already has loyal as well as casual customers who visit her business. Cinthia also visits her customers door-to-door, since she has increased her customers this way. Cinthia Carolina is asking for a loan in order to invest in her business by purchasing a variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary machines to stay updated with his staff in order to provide the best possible customer service.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  He sells shoes to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 12 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

Charles hopes to fully establish his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es una persona que es reconocida en su familia y entre sus vecinos por ser muy amoroso con su hijo de 11 años, a quien tuvo que separa de su madre desde hace poco tiempo puesto que ella le daba malos tratos. 
Juan Carlos desde entonces esta a cargo de su hijo, y en la obligación de generar mayores ingresos para poder sostener todos sus gastos empezó a remodelar un local en donde abrirá un negocio de comidas rápidas. Juan Carlos siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su hijo, y es por esto que desde que se separaron de su madre le ha querido cubrir todas las necesidades a cabalidad, sin embargo, sus bajos ingresos no le permiten hacerlo, y apenas puede cubrir sus necesidades vagamente. Juan Carlos aspira a abrir un negocio de comidas rápidas a las afueras de su vivienda en un local que esta abandonado, pero que él le ha estado realizando algunas adecuaciones. Hasta el momento, por la falta de capital, Juan Carlos no ha podido realizarle grandes cambios al local, por lo que aspira a que con un préstamo pueda acceder a terminar de adecuar el local y a comprar unas sillas que le permitan tener por completo el local de comidas rápidas. Juan Carlos sueña con que su negocio le genere grandes ingresos, y pueda así brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, le pueda ofrecer un mejor estudio que el que cursa actualmente, y le pueda brindar una mejor estabilidad económica en un futuro.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is well-known in his community for being a doting father to his 11-year-old son, who he has had to separate from his mother due to her unfair treatment of their son. Since then, Juan Carlos has been in charge of his son and is under the obligation of earning a higher income to cover their expenses. He started to remodel a location where he will open a fast food business. Juan Carlos has always considered his child's well-being, which is why he has been trying to cover his son's needs following the separation from his mother. However, his low income makes it difficult for him to support their needs. 

Juan Carlos hopes to open a fast food business outside his house in an abandoned location that he has been improving. Until now, due to the lack of capital, Juan Carlos has not been able to make any major changes to the location. With this loan, he will be able to complete these changes and buy chairs so that he can complete customizing the location for a fast food business.

He hopes that his business will increase his income to provide his son with an improved quality of life, better education, and added economic stability for the future.

loans.use: Adecuar el local y comprar unas sillas que le permitan tener su local de comidas rápidas.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a twenty-nine-year-old man; he is single and has no children but supports his parents. He runs a retail shop in Kangemi where he sells things like sugar, soap, maize flour, etc. Herbert has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of forty-five thousand shillings.


This will be Herbert’s first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for his retail shop, buying sugar, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. for resale. With the profit that he will get, he wants to pay school fees for his younger brother. In future he wants to  open another retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, basins, etc.

loans.name: Kudra

texts.en:
Kudra is a married man with no children. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 
Kudra has operated a retail shop for the past 6 years. His potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of rising costs of commodities in the market. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.
With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase more stock of cereals, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for resale. He decided to join Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cereals, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with two family members who both work.

Hatem has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $3000 in order to purchase a fridge, to make an advertising light box, and to add more foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge, to make an advertising light box, and to add more foodstuffs for his market.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children and lives with nine family members.

Since 2008, Diyaa has owned a shop selling mattress upholstery. He has plenty of experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers. He is also well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2400 in order to extend his shop and to purchase an upholstery sewing machine. He aims to gain more profits so that he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to extend his shop and to purchase an upholstery sewing machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and has one child.

Since 2007, Ali has owned a store repairing and fixing wheels. He has experience in this field, has a good reputation, and is well known in the surrounding areas. 

He is requesting a loan of $2400 in order to purchase a wheel balancing machine for his store. He aims to gain more profits so that he is able to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a wheel balancing machine for his store.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while the other is still too young for school.  Her husband Eliud, who is employed, also provides income to help meet the family’s basic needs.  Immaculate lives in a rental house with electricity and running water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and rent. 

Immaculate has operated a retail shop for the past six years.  Her potential clients are members of the local community.  The main challenge she faces in her business is transportation.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she plans to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and soap to add to her stock to sell.  She decided to join Yehu in order to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children.

Assaad has been the owner of a bakery since 2009, selling bread and pastries. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order renovate his bakery and to build a new stone oven. He is aiming to earn more profit so as to be able to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery and to build a new stone oven.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children.

Majid has been the owner of a shop since 2007, selling animal feed. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; and he has sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to extend his shop. He is aiming to earn more profits to have an opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to extend his shop.

loans.name: Warnass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has five children.

Warnass is a grocer; in 2006 he opened his own store selling all kinds of vegetables and fruit. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2100 loan in order to rent an extra store. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to rent an extra store.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a 43-year-old married man with 4 children all of whom attend school. His wife, Amina, who is employed also contributes to the provision of family's basic needs. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Rama has operated a rental house business for the past 10 years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of owning another house for rent.

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase materials for renovating his rental house and to pay for labor services. Rama decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase materials for renovating his rental house and to pay for labor services.

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 41 years old, married and has four children.

Since 2008, Maytham has owned a shop, selling womens accessories and perfumes.  He has over three years of experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs.  He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 in order to expand his shop and make an advertising light box.  He aims to increase his profits and to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to expand his shop and make an advertising light box.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 40-year-old married man and the father of four children. Khaled works hard to improve his business. He is a man with a very good reputation. 

Khaled had a very good experience with Kiva partner Al Majmoua and has a good standing repayment history.

Khaled has worked in repairing cars and vehicles for 23 years. This experience gives his customer's a sense of trust and commitment.

Khaled is working hard to improve his business, that's why he is starting to expand it, through a requested loan from KIva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for what's left from the price of a car he bought in order to fix and sell it.

So,Khaled is heading towards trading with cars, which is a good way to increase his income and to improve his living. He hopes to keep on expanding his business in the future as much as he can.

loans.use: to pay what he owes on the price of a car he bought.

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Alieu. He is married to a trader and has two school-going children, ages 10 and 7 years. In 2004, Alieu established his provisions, toiletries and top cards (mobile) business. He did not go to school as his father does not respect education. His father was a cattle rearer and, when he grew up, he decided to join him in the same trade. During the war in Sierra Leone – specifically in his home town, Kabala – he lost all his cattle which forced him to come and settle in Makeni town, where he started as a peddler. Over some years, he raised a huge sum of money and opened a shop. Till now, his business has improved gradually.

Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, Alieu earns about 1,892,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. He is assisted by family members. Alieu has already received and successfully repaid one loan. He would like a new loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. He requires this loan in order to purchase cigarettes (Bond - 1 carton for 1,000,000 SLL and Gold Seal for 600,000 SLL), top-up cards (30,000 units for 38,000 SLL), sugar (2 bags for 260,000 SLL) and toothpaste (1 carton for 140,000 SLL). He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 473,000 SLL.

In the future, Alieu plans to open a bigger outlet to display his goods. He is nervous about the future prospects of his business because he wants to open a bigger shop so that he can be selling wholesale. The rise and fall in foreign currency can cause high prices in the cost of goods, and while meeting customers’ needs, sometimes it affects his sales and reduces his profit. Competition is not high because he is the only retailer in the area dealing with these products. 

Alieu serves about 50 people per day. He serves people from around the city – at least 20 people per day. He also serves people from the surroundings and people from nearby villages. His business is popular because he treats his customers fairly and respects their views. He buys his goods in Conakry twice per month and in Freetown once every week by vehicle. He uses his profit to buy more stock for his business. He is a hardworking and very committed businessman. He hopes to repay his loan on time in order to access subsequent loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes (Bond and Gold Seal), top-up cards, sugar and toothpaste.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents. His father is responsible for covering the heavy costs of life. Ali opened his own car mechanic shop in 2000, with 20 years of experience in this domain. He’s a good mechanic looking to better develop his work. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1,300 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase new mechanical tools for his shop. This loan will facilitate his operations and bring him profitable returns. In the future, Ali plans to enlarge his garage and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28 year-old single man and owner of a big transportation truck since 2010.  He transports rocks, sand and alot of construction tools and machines, in addition to any other requested products to be transported.  Ali is a hardworking man.  He seeks perfection in everything, especially in his business and with his customers.

Ali applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance for his truck, to keep it in a good shape all the time.  Ali is looking forward to expanding his business more and more in the future.  He hopes he will be capable of buying another truck.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance for his truck

loans.name: Sabeh

texts.en:
Sabeh is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, one of whom works while the other is still studying. Sabeh cooperates with his son in order to cover the family expenses.

Sabeh has been working as a car mechanic since 1992 and has his own garage. He’s well known for both his good work and good reputation. Today, he needs to borrow $2,100 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase a new generator for his business in order to carry on his work properly and nonstop. In the future, Sabeh plans to take out more Kiva loans and improve his garage.

loans.use: to purchase a new generator for his business

loans.name: Abdel Hadi

texts.en: Abdel Hadi is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. Since 2005, he has had a store selling mobile phones and accessories. He has experience in this field and  a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in the surrounding area. Abdel Hadi decided to apply for a $2700 loan in order to rent and expand into the shop next door. He is aiming to gain more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: In order to rent and expand into the shop next door.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
General merchandise retailing in Kyenjojo has been Alex's business preoccupation for the past 2 years.  Commodities like sugar, maize flour, beans, cooking oil, salt, rice, milk, paraffin, etc., are what you will find at Alex's outlet.  Alex is buoyant and highly focused. He is married and has eight kids.
Week in and week out, he says his sales returns add up to UGX 30,000.  On the side, Alex also ekes out more income from a food sales business.
He is hoping he can further consolidate the gains he has made in the new year.
He says he will bank on this loan to purchase more retail items such as rice, beans, maize flour, cooking oil, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail items such as rice, beans, maize flour, cooking oil, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Fausto Xavier

texts.es:
Fausto Xavier tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Fausto Xavier se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventas de los productos lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá aumentar las hectáreas que sembraba y mejorar el manejo del cultivo, Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas. 

El sueño es terminar los estudios y llegar a comprar una finca para así mejorar la calidad de vida.En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el indor y el futbol.
texts.en:
Fausto Xavier is 21 years old. He is single, doesn't have any children, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Divino Niño communal bank, which is located in Estero Lindo, in Ventanas canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Fausto is a farmer who grows corn. He buys his products and makes his sales in Ventanas.

Fausto is requesting this loan to buy seeds, urea, manure, fertilizers, and supplies.  The support of this loan will help him get more land to plant and to improve the management of the crops.   He faces challenges such as pests.

His dream is to finish his education and to buy a farm in order to improve his quality of life.

In his free time he likes taking part in sports, especially indoor and outdoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, manure, fertilizers, and supplies.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 32-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife. Like every couple, they’re looking to have children. Abbas is working under pressure to be able to offer them a good future. He has owned a car spare parts shop since 1997 in his town. Since he is known for his good work, people visit him from all neighboring areas. Today, Abbas has the intention of borrowing $1,300 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l,, to purchase more spare car parts for his business. He notes that this will increase his sales, thus his revenues. In the future, he plans to sell cars and have his own car showroom.

loans.use: to purchase more spare car parts for his business

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Norma, continua con la venta de ropa y zapatos, teniendo muchos encargos cada dia, el mejoramiento a su vivienda ha sido su prioridad, en donde atraves de financiamiento y ahorros ha logrado el objetivo.
Como madre, ha apoyado a sus hijos, hoy en dia, casados, sola logro la educacion de sus hijos.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, continuara, de cerrar el porche, en donde logro abanzar bastante, comprara materiales de construccion, para terminar de repellar paredes, embaldozado, techo y portones. Lo que esta contenta ya que tendra espacio en donde reposar mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is still running her business selling shoes and clothes. She has plenty of orders everyday. Improving her house has been her priority and she achieved her goal thanks to her savings and loans.
She was a great support for her children as they grew up. All of them are now married. She was able to provide them with education on her own effort. 
With this new loan she will close her house's porch, where she has made a significant progress. She will purchase construction materials in order to finish the walls, as well as tiles, roofs and doors. This makes her happy because she will have a place in which to rest more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for completely closing her house's front porch

loans.name: Pedro Damian

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 36 años de edad vive en la ciudad de mala, ubicada al sur de nuestra capital, el convive con su pareja desde hace 3 años y tienen un pequeño de 2 años de edad, su pareja lo apoya mucho en todo lo que el hace, el nos comenta que es su mano derecha y a la única que le hace caso cuando se siente mal o preocupado por los problemas que como toda persona puede tener, juntos viven en la casa de la mama de Pedro que generosamente les ha brindado un cuarto para que puedan vivir.

Pedro trabaja de sol a sol como decimos en Perú, el se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi, desde hace 2 años, el se levanta muy temprano, en algunas ocasiones tiene trabajos extras ya sea en el campo para la cosecha de algún producto así como también en la construcción, también en ocasiones vende pollos; el es una persona mil oficios y es que si es un trabajo honrado porque no realizarlo, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias sin parar, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios esta a su lado y es el único que lo guía por el buen camino y también porque su hijo es la mejor motivación que tiene para salir adelante.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá dar mantenimiento a su mototaxi  abrir un nuevo negocio basado en la crianza de pollos, con este nuevo negocio el podrá tener mayores ingresos para mejorar  su calidad de vida y darle lo mejor a su hijo, así como también seguir ahorrando para poder tener otro negocio que es la venta de abarrotes y seguir creciendo para cumplir su gran sueño:” darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Pedro is 36 years old and he lives in the city of Mala, south of the capital.  He has lived with his partner for three years and they have a two-year-old son.  His partner supports him a lot in all that he does and he tells us that she's his right hand and she's the only one who listens to him when he's feeling bad or worried about problems that everyone faces.  They live together in Pedro's mother's house where she has generously offered them a room.

Pedro works "from sun to sun" as they say in Peru.  He has worked in transportation on his mototaxi for two years.  He gets up very early in the morning and sometimes he gets extra work doing things like helping in the fields when there's a harvest, doing construction work, or sometimes selling chickens.  He's a person with a thousand trades because if you find honest work, why not do it?  He works around 10 hours a day without stopping.  He thinks his business is going well because God is on his side and He is the only one who guides him down the right path and also because his son is the best motivation he could have to get ahead.

Pedro is very thankful to Kiva's lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to perform maintenance on his mototaxi and start a new business raising chickens.  This new business will allow him to earn more so he can improve his quality of life and give his son the best.  It will also allow him to keep saving to be able to start another business selling groceries and to keep growing so he can achieve his greatest dream, which is to offer his son a profession.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his mototaxi and to start a business raising chickens

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre bueno y amable, tiene 51 años y es padre de nueve hijos de los cuales seis ya son independientes mientras que tres aun son menores, lamentablemente él se separó de su esposa y de sus tres hijos Elizabeth de 15, Carmen de 12 y Walter de 7 años. Pero mantiene relación con sus hijos y sin descuidar de su aliemntación y educación. Francisco tiene un trabajo muy dinámico, pues tiene que estar en constante movimiento de un lugar a otro, se va a diferentes lugares cercanos del distrito en el cual vive, entra las chacras, granjas y caseríos en busca de animales para comprarlos, una vez que obtiene los animales se dirige al centro para su venta. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 14 años y es una actividad que le permitió hasta el momento poder brindar todo lo mejor a su familia. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede disponer de su tiempo como mejor se acomode, además de poder viajar a muchos lugares. Hasta el momento tiene un buen mercado el cual le permite ir directo sin tener que dar muchas vueltas y estar perdiendo el tiempo. Sus clientes le dan a un buen precio y él puede ganar un buen porcentaje en sus ventas y así obtiene ganancias muy buenas. Ahora espera seguir trabajando mucho para crecer su negocio. Este será el crédito número tres con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financieros y así aumentar su capital de trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mas animales para seguir llevando a vender en los mercados y camales de la ciudad.
texts.en: Francisco is a good, kind man.  He is 51 years old and the father of nine children, six of whom are now independent, while the remaining three are still minors.  Unfortunately, he is separated from his wife and his three children, 15-year-old Elizabeth, 12-year-old Carmen, and 7-year-old Walter.  However, he keeps in touch with his children and makes sure they are fed and educated.  Francisco has a very dynamic job, as he has to be constantly moving from one place to another.  He goes to different places close to the district he lives in, approaching small farms, large farms, and country houses looking for animals to buy.  Once he has the animals, he goes downtown to sell them.  He has been doing this work for 14 years now and so far it has allowed him to offer his family all the best.  He likes his work a lot because it allows him to spend his time as it best suits him and because it lets him travel to many different places.  At the moment he has a good market that he can go to straight to without having to go all over wasting time.  His customers give him good prices and he takes home a good percentage of his sales, which results in good earnings for him.  Now he wants to keep working a lot to make his business grow.  This will be his third loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he has the financial support to increase his working capital.  He also promises to make his payments on time as he did with his previous loans.  He will use the 3,000 nuevos soles to buy more animals to take for sale in the city's markets and meat markets.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Manuel Olegario

texts.es:
El Señor. Manuel es socio del Banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su Iglesia se encuentra ubicada en el Centro Parroquial y posee más de doscientos años de antigüedad, la Laguna de Tari, se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a unos 5 kilómetros del Centro Parroquial. Su gente es amable, responsable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

El Señor. Manuel tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive en casa con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa es propiedad de sus padres.
 
El se dedica a laborar como talador de madera, actividad que la desempeña hace 5 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de arboles para continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is a member of the communal bank Unión y Prosperidad (Union and Prosperity). He lives in the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a place where you can admire the beauty of nature. Its church is located in the Central Parish and is over 200 years old. The Tari Lagoon is located about 5 kilometers from the Central Parish. The people are friendly and responsible, and they continue the culture and traditions of their villages. 

Manuel is 25 years old, single, and lives in his parents’ house with whom he shares the household costs. His parents own the house. 

He works as a logger, work that he’s been doing for 5 years, and he works from Monday to Saturday. 

He’s in his second loan cycle with the communal bank, and he will invest his 9th loan into the purchase of trees in order to continue his business. 
 
His dream is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy trees.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 49-year-old Lebanese married woman. She’s cooperating with her husband who’s working outside the country in order to satisfy their needs. As for her, she has been working in preparing home food since 2010 and delivering it to the neighboring areas upon request. She also has her own home products shop. Today, she is looking to borrow $1100 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of food and provisions in order to carry on her work properly. In that way, she will boost her productivity and therefore her earnings. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase food and provisions

loans.name: Jorge Leon

texts.es:
Jorge León ha sido una persona muy trabajadora durante toda su vida. Inicialmente trabajaba en el campo, con la actividad de la agricultura, pero esta actividad no le daba los ingresos suficientes para poder sostener a su esposa y a sus 4 hijos. Jorge León entonces pasó a trabajar en las tiendas generales, y en esta actividad lleva aproximadamente 18 meses, y gracias a esta hoy genera los ingresos suficientes para poder mantener los gastos de su hogar. Jorge León tiene un gran inconveniente y es que debido a la inseguridad en el sector, existen delincuentes que le piden a menudo dinero, por lo que los ingresos no siempre son los esperados. Con el ánimo de aumentar sus ingresos, para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, Jorge León busca comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad y así podrá aumentar sus ventas. Sin embargo, Jorge León no cuenta con el capital suficiente en la actualidad, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de los productos con los que quiere aumentar su oferta en su tienda. 

Jorge León sueña con que su negocio crezca y se consolide de modo que pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Jorge León has been a very hard-working person throughout his whole life.  He initially worked in the country, in agriculture, but this activity did not give him enough income to be able to support his wife and his 4 children.  Jorge León then went on to work in general stores.  He has been doing this activity for approximately 18 months, and thanks to this he makes enough money today to cover his household costs.  Jorge León has a great inconvenience, and it is that due to the insecurity of the area, there are criminals that ask him for small amounts of money.  This is why his income never meets his expectations.  With the goal of increasing his income so that he can provide a better quality of life to his family, Jorge León wants to buy a larger quantity of products, so that he can offer his customers a better variety and therefore increase his sales.  However, Jorge León doesn't have enough money currently.  That's why he is hoping that a loan will allow him to buy products, with which he wants to increase his store's offerings.

Jorge León dreams that his business will grow and strengthen so that he can create jobs for the most needy people.

loans.use: to buy products that will allow him to increase the variety of items that he offers to his customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 29 years old and very hard-working, living in Hioma, Uganda. He works as a credit officer and he faces a challenge of price fluctuations and low salary. He hopes to build a permanent family house and his business goal is to buy land for growing crops. He intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma 30, is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is paying rent bills.

For the past one year, he has operated a kiosk (retail) shop business, selling household consumption items like maize flour, wheat flour and sugar to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Juma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28 years old, single and has for the last two years worked hard at selling electrical goods. He is determined to improve his current business and start a new one selling candies and sweets in wholesale markets. To open this new business, he has applied for a loan, his second from our organization, to buy a van. He hopes to earn enough money to start a family in the future, because he believes that this is an achievement he can be proud of.

loans.use: to buy a van to start a new business.

loans.name: Osman Rodolfo

texts.es:
Osman Rodolfo, de 29 años de edad, casado desde hace dos años, tiene un hijo de un año de edad, vive en el  Barrio llanos de la Virgen de Intibucá, Intibucá.

Osman anteriormente trabajo en una tienda de TIGO, pero sus ingresos eran bajos y decidió mejor establecer su propio negocio de venta de ropa americana de segunda, hace 4 años que inicio y actualmente tiene dos locales de negocio, para atenderlos le apoya su esposa, atiende a los clientes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 y media de la tarde.
Es un negocio rentable en la zona ya que la ropa nueva es muy cara y la gente prefiere usar ropa de segunda por barata. El compra los fardos y la clasifica. Su familia vendía este producto y miro que es rentable pues decidió tener su propio negocio para crecer económicamente. Con el préstamo que solicita va comprar fardos de ropa para surtir e incrementar sus ventas.
Con las ganancias va ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Osman Rodolfo, age 29, has been married for two years and has a one year old son.  He lives in the Llanos de La Virgen neighborhood of Intibucá, Intibucá.

Osman previously worked in a TIGO store, but his income was very low.  He decided it would be better to establish his own business selling second-hand American cloths.  He started four years ago, and he currently has two business locations.  His wife helps him tend to them.  He takes care of customers from eight in the morning until five thirty in the afternoon.

His business is profitable in the zone because new clothes are very expensive.  People prefer used clothes because they are cheaper.  He buys the bundles and sorts them.  His family sold this product, and he saw that it was profitable.  He decided to have his own business in order to grow financially.

He will use the requested loan to buy bundles of clothes to stock up on and to increase his sales.  He will save his earnings in order to build his house.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes to stock his business.

loans.name: Bernardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bernardo a sus 40 años de edad es padre de  una hija de 12 años, a la cual ha sacado adelante gracias a la venta de dulces, snacks y gaseosas en un pequeño local en el cual trabaja junto con su esposa desde hace 12 años. Debido al invierno, el señor Bernardo tuvo que cerrar por un tiempo su local, lo cual le generar muchas perdidas, y por esto necesita de capital con el cual pueda comprar de nuevo surtido para su negocio y reactivar sus ventas y con esto su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Bernardo, 40, is the father of a 12-year-old daughter, whom he has gotten ahead thanks to selling sweets, snacks, and sodas in a small place where he has been working with his wife for 12 years.  Because of winter, Bernardo had to close the store for a time, which generates many losses for him.  For this reason he needs to buy new stock for his business to reactivate his sales and so his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: María Lisseth

texts.es:
María Lisseth se dedica a la actividad de docencia en el municipio de Achuapa desde hace varios años. Su oficio es de mucha importancia porque por medio de este, se forjan los grandes profesionales del mañana, además que es un canal para el desarrollo de la nación y por este motivo, ella se siente muy satisfecha con su trabajo. 

Actualmente, está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo exclusivamente en la compra de un molino el cual es un negocio donde se brinda servicio para moler todo tipo de granos, con el objetivo de generar más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, ya que con su salario no sustenta los gastos del hogar. 

Una vez que adquiera el molino, iniciará a trabajarlo atendiendo a sus clientes y así obtendrá mejores ingresos para beneficio propio y de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
María Lisseth has worked for several years as a teacher in the town of Achuapa.  Her position is of much importance because, through her work, she shapes the great professionals of the future.  Besides, it is a way to develop the nation.  For this reason, she feels very satisfied with her work.

Right now, she is asking for a loan to invest entirely in the purchase of a mill, which is a business where she offers the service of grinding all kinds of grains.  She has the goal of making more income for the wellbeing of her family, since her salary does not cover the household costs.

Once she has the mill, she will begin to use it to assist her customers.  In this ways she will obtain more income for the benefit of herself and for the family that she loves so much.

loans.use: buy a mill.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a 42-year-old married man with seven children, six of whom attend school while the other one is still too young for school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Mwero has operated a retail shop for the past year. He also sells charcoal. His potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge in not having a big enough market for his business. He dreams of expanding his business. With this 25,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar is 29 years old; he is married with two children. They live in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. Ganbaatar is a military man, but he also runs a commercial store for more than five years. His wife works as a cashier at the store. Beside his store, Ganbaatar wants to sell smokeless fuel (the Mongolian government suggests people use it) in order to reduce air pollution in the cities and towns of Mongolia. He said that selling the smokeless fuel is not very profitable, but he wants to lend a hand to the environment. 

He dreams to have his own house to live in. He is requesting a loan to purchase smokeless fuel and increase his working capital for his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase smokeless fuel and increase his working capital for his grocery store.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos Humberto se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, y siempre ha querido superarse a si mismo. 
Carlos Humberto siempre ha estado buscando métodos para poder generar más ingresos para su hogar, pues asegura que para el lo más importante son su esposa y su hijo de 6 años, a quien le quiere brindar todo lo que necesita para salir adelante. 
Desde hace aproximadamente 4 años y medio, Carlos Humberto decidió dejar de un lado la actividad de cargar cajas en la plaza de comidas de su región, para montar su propio puesto de venta de legumbres y frutas, pues veía que con esta actividad podría generar más ingresos para su hogar. Desde entonces se viene desempeñando en esta actividad y gracias a su buena atención, y a la calidad de los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, ha sido reconocido en el sector y ya lo tienen como un referente a la hora de hacer sus compras. Sin embargo, la desventaja que tiene Carlos Humberto respecto a las demás personas que venden legumbres y frutas en el mismo sector, es que Carlos Humberto no tiene su propio puesto de ventas, por lo que le toca hacerlo a las afueras de otros negocios de ventas. Para Carlos Humberto ha sido muy difícil tener que sobreponerse a dicha situación, y manifiesta que si tuviera su propio local para sus ventas, sus ingresos serían mucho mejores que los actuales. 
Carlos Humberto quiere ahorrar para poder acceder a comprar o arrendar un local en el futuro, por lo que estima que primero debe empezar por aumentar sus ventas. Es por esto que Carlos Humberto pretende comprar un surtido mayor de frutas y legumbres y poder hacer más atractivo su negocio para los clientes ofreciendo una mayor variedad de productos, sin embargo Carlos Humberto no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacer esta compra y espera que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de frutas y verduras que aumenten la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes. 
Carlos Humberto espera que con mayor variedad de productos, sus ventas se incrementen considerablemente, y de esta manera podrá ubicarse en un local donde sea más atractivo para la compra de sus clientes. Y luego que se encuentre ubicado en el local, estima que sus ventas serán muy superiores, y podrá así cumplir su sueño de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, y a su hijo le podrá brindar la mejor educación posible y un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto has been characterized as being a person who is very dedicated to his work and to his family, and who always wants to improve himself.  Carlos Humberto is always seeking methods to be able to generate more income for his home.  He assures us that most important are his wife and son of 6 years, to whom he wants to offer everything that he needs to do well.  Approximately 4 and a half years ago, Carlos Humberto decided to set aside the activity of selling boxes in the food market of his region to open his own vegetable and fruit stand, as he saw that this activity would generate more income for his home.  Since then he has performed this activity and, thanks to his good service and the quality of the products that he offers his clients, he has been recognized in the sector and already has become  preferred by people at the moment they make their purchases.  

Nevertheless, the disadvantage that Carlos Humberto has with respect to the other people that sell vegetables and fruits in the same sector, is that Carlos Humberto does not have his own sales position, which means he must perform his sales on the outskirts of the other sales businesses.  For Carlos Humberto it has been very difficult to have to overcome said situation, and he declares that if he had his own sales location, his income would be a lot better than currently.  Carlos Humberto wants to save to be able to buy or lease a location in the future, for which he estimates that first he should begin to enlarge his sales.  It is for this reason that Carlos Humberto intends to buy a greater assortment of fruits and vegetables and to be able to make his business more attractive to the clients, offering a greater variety of products.  However Carlos Humberto does not have sufficient capital to make this purchase and hopes for a loan to permit him to purchase the fruits and vegetables that will enlarge the variety of products that he offers his clients.  

Carlos Humberto expects that with a greater variety of products, his sales be increased considerably, and in this manner he will be able to move to a location which will be more attractive to his clients.  And as soon as he is in the location, he estimates that his sales will be much greater, and he will be able thus to fulfill his dream to offer a better quality of life to his wife, and to be able to offer his son the best possible education and a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to increase the variety of products that he offers his clients.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es reconocido en su sector por ser una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante. Desde muy joven siempre se quiso independizar y poder ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, de modo que les pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y les pueda ofrecer un futuro mejor. Sus padres siempre han sido unas personas muy trabajadoras, y les tocó esforzarse mucho para poder sacar a Gustavo adelante, por lo que ahora Gustavo quiere devolverles todo lo que han hecho por el brindándoles una mejor vida que la que pueden acceder actualmente. Gustavo inició el negocio de la papelería desde hace ya algún tiempo, y gracias a que los productos que vende Gustavo son de muy buena calidad, y a que la atención de Gustavo siempre es la mejor, sus clientes ya lo tienen como un referente a la hora de comprar sus productos. 
Gustavo tiene un gran sueño y es el de poder brindarles a sus padres la posibilidad de descansar y que no tengan que trabajar más, pues han trabajado muy fuerte durante toda su vida, pero Gustavo sabe que para poder cumplir ese sueño es necesario que su negocio de la papelería le genere mayores ingresos a los que le genera actualmente. Es por esto que Gustavo está buscando la posibilidad de aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes en su papelería, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo. De modo que Gustavo está en vísperas de que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de mercancía de papelería como son cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, tijeras, entre otros productos más que le permitan hacer su negocio más atractivo para todas las personas de su sector. 
Gustavo aspira a que con el aumento de la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes aumenten sus ventas significativamente, y pueda así cumplir su sueño de poder brindarles a sus padres una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo is known in his area for being a hardworking person with a desire to move ahead.  Since he was very young, he has always wanted to be independent and to be able to help his parents with the household costs so that they could improve their quality of life, and so that he could offer them a better future.  His parents have always been very hardworking people, and they made a great effort to help Gustavo get ahead.  Now Gustavo wants to return the favor to them, and offer them a better life than they currently have.  Gustavo began his stationary store business a while ago.  Thanks to the very good quality of the products that Gustavo sells and to Gustavo's great service, his customers already have his business in mind when it is time to buy their products.
Gustavo has a big dream.  It is to be able to offer his parents the opportunity to rest, so that they no longer have to work since they have worked very hard throughout their lives.  But Gustavo knows that to be able to fulfill his dream, it is necessary that his stationary business generate greater income than it is making currently.  This is why Gustavo is looking for the possibility to increase the variety of products that he offers to his customers in the stationary store.  However, he does not have sufficient funds to do this.  This is why Gustavo is hoping that a loan will allow him to purchase the merchandise for his stationary store like notebooks, pens, erasers, scissors, among other products that will allow him to make his business more attractive to all the people in his area.
Gustavo hopes that with the increase in the variety of products that he offers to his customers, that his sales will significantly increase.  He hopes that that he will therefore be able to fulfill his dream of being able to offer his parents stable finances and a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy stationary store merchandise to increase the variety of products that he offers to his customers.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor María se ha dedicado toda su vida a atender lo mejor posible su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Siempre ha estado dispuesta a ayudarles en lo que requieran y por esto ahora genera ingresos para aportar a los gastos del hogar y mejorar así la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Flor María siempre ha querido que sus hijos tengan la mejor educación posible, sin embargo los bajos ingresos de su esposo y ella no les permite acceder a la mejor educación de su sector. Por esto, Flor María trabaja constantemente con más esmero, para que su negocio genere unos mayores ingresos y pueda brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación.
Flor María se dedica desde hace algún tiempo a la venta de mercancía por catálogo, y gracias a su buen servicio se ha ganado gran parte de la clientela de su sector. La desventaja que tiene Flor María es que muchas veces cuando vende a crédito, sus clientes se retrazan en los pagos que deben hacer, por lo que se ve muy escasa de dinero. 
Flor María busca que su negocio aumente sus ventas, para poder brindarles la mejor educación a sus hijos, por lo que pretende aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Sin embargo, debido a pagos atrasados por parte de sus clientes, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de la mercancía, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de mercancía de uso personal como productos de belleza y lociones, y pueda así ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Flor María aspira a que sus ventas aumenten significativamente, y de esta manera con los ingresos extras, poder ahorrar para que sus hijos puedan acceder en un futuro a una carrera de educación superior y esto les brinde la posibilidad de acceder a un trabajo bien remunerado en un futuro.
texts.en:
Flor Maria has dedicated her whole life to caring for her husband and their 4 children.  She has always been ready to help them with whatever they need, and to do this now, she generates income to contribute toward the household expenses. In this way she can improve the quality of life of her husband and their 4 children.  Flor Maria has always wanted her children to have the best education possible.  However, the income that she and her husband earn has not been sufficient to allow them to access the best education in their area.  For this reason, Flor Maria works constantly and with a lot of care, so that her business will generate more income.  This way she could provide her children with a good education.

For some time now Flor Maria has been selling merchandise through a catalog, and thanks to her good service, she has attracted a good share of the customers in her area. The disadvantage that Flor Maria faces is that many times when she sells on credit her customers are late in making their payments, because money is very tight.

Flor Maria seeks to increase her sales, so that she can provide a better education to her children.  To do this, she plans to increase the variety of products that she offers to her customers.  However, because some of her customers are behind on their payments, she lacks the capital she needs to purchase this additional merchandise.  This is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to make this purchase of personal care products, such as beauty products and lotions, so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

Flor Maria hopes that her sales will increase significantly, which will allow her to increase her earnings and save so that in the future her children can go to college.  This will allow them to have a high-paying job in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as beauty products, lotions, and other items, so that she can offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy repair parts, tools and a showcase to display his products.

loans.name: Hosep

texts.en: Hosep is a 60-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and two children. He strives to work really hard to cover all their costs and expenses. He has owned a carpentry business since 1970 and became expert in his field. Today, he wants a loan of $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the necessary quantity of wood for his work. He notes that this will improve his business and thus his way of living. In the future, he plans to hire someone to work for him.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary quantity of wood for his work.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor  Mario vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, el se dedica  a  la  compra y venta de papa en la localidad de el Torno compra por mayor de los  campesinos de la zona y también de la ciudad de Sucre y luego lo revende, el señor es separado de su esposa, tiene dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad pero viven  con el.   El destino del crédito es para la compra de  papa por mayor  ya que tiene bastante  pedido para entregar ya que  hay mucha demanda en estos días y quiere aprovechar eso, realizara el viaje a Sucre de donde trae también una buena cantidad de papa,  El se encuentra en su  decima secta secuencia, siempre a cancelado puntual,  por tal motivo se siente feliz y  muy  agradecido por el apoyo económico brindado por la institución.
texts.en:
Mario lives in the town of Puerto Rico. He buys and sells in Torno, buying potatoes wholesale from the farmers of the area, and also from the city of Sucre, and later he resells them.

He is separated from his wife. He has two children. They are adults but live with him.

He will use the money from the loan to buy potatoes at wholesale as he already has orders to deliver because the demand is high these days and he wants to take advantage of it, making the trip to Sucre where he brings a lot of potatoes. 

He is in the tenth loan cycle and always has been punctual with payments, and this is why he feels happy and very grateful for the financial help provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Jorge Mauricio

texts.es:
Jorge Mauricio es un joven de 21 años que se ha visto golpeado por la violencia y las pocas oportunidades que le brindó la vida. Desde hace 10 años tuvo que abandonar su municipio natal para mudarse a la ciudad de Medellín con su madre; cuando llegaron Jorge Mauricio no pudo acceder a una educación debido a los problemas económicos de su familia, por lo que decidió emprender su propio negocio y montó una tienda general. Desde entonces, Jorge Mauricio es quién sostiene los gastos del hogar donde convive con su madre, y aspira a que su negocio le pueda brindar un buen futuro y una buena calidad de vida. 
Jorge Mauricio es un referente en su sector para comprar los productos de la canasta familiar debido a que ofrece un muy buen servicio, es una persona muy amable y siempre brinda una sonrisa a sus clientes.
Jorge Mauricio aspira a que su negocio incremente sus ventas para poder prosperar económicamente y brindarle un mejor futuro a su madre, pues es una persona que toda la vida le tocó luchar contra adversidades.
Para que su negocio aumente sus ventas, necesita comprar más productos para ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes, sin embargo en la actualidad no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo. Es por esto que espera que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecer en su tienda general y poder así aumentar sus ventas.
Jorge Mauricio espera que con los ingresos extras que va a generar pueda ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre y puedan prosperar económicamente, para que en un futuro puedan tener una estabilidad económica tan anhelada por ellos.
texts.en:
Jorge Mauricio is a young, 21 year old man who has suffered from the violence and the lack of opportunities that life has brought him. Ten years ago, he had to leave his native town and move to the city of Medellín with his mother. When they arrived, Jorge Mauricio couldn't access education due to his family's financial problems. He decided to start his own business and opened a general store. Jorge Mauricio is the person who pays for the household expenses in the home he shares with his mother. He aspires to having his business offer a good future and a good quality of life.  

Jorge Mauricio is a person others go to in his area to buy basic food basket products because he offers very good service. He is a friendly person and always has a smile for his customers.

Jorge Mauricio wants his business to increase its sales so he can prosper financially and offer his mother  better future, because she is a person who has had to fight against adversity her whole life.  

In order for his business to increase its sales, he needs to buy more products to offer more variety for his customers. Nonetheless, he doesn't have enough capital right now to do it. that is why he hopes that a loan will allow him to access buying basic food basket products to offer in his general store and thus increase his sales.  

Jorge Mauricio hopes that with the extra income that he will generate, he can offer a better quality of life to his mother and they can proper financially, so in the future they can have the financial stability they have so wished for.

loans.use: to buy basic food basket products to increase the amount of products he can offer his customers.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 42-year-old Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s putting all his effort into responding to his family's requests. 

In 2000, Abbas decided to start his own business as a contractor, and already has 25 years of experience in this domain. His job consists of installing bricks. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional construction materials for his business. This loan will facilitate his business operations and push him to take on new projects. In the future, he plans to improve his business and work hard in order to serve his customers as quickly as he can.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a curio shop business, selling to tourists visiting the area. In addition, he also owns a matatu (motor vehicle) for public transport which is his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Philip dreams of establishing a wholesale curio shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000, he wants to add stock to his curio shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to add stock to his curio shop.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
Maria Irene es una persona que es reconocida por ser una persona muy amable y brindar una muy buena atención en su negocio. Maria Irene manifiesta que para ella lo más importante es poder brindarles un bienestar a las otras personas, y siempre y cuando esté en el poder de uno hacerlo siempre intentará lograrlo. 
Maria Irene se desempeña trabajando en su tienda general, la cual tiene hace aproximadamente 8 años, y gracias a esta, genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su hijo. 
Maria Irene sueña con que su negocio se consolide en su sector, para que sus ventas aumenten y poder así mejorar su calidad de vida actual. Además, quiere que su negocio crezca y algún día se convierta en un mini-mercado el cual genere mucho empleo y del cual pueda vivir ella cuando ya su salud no le permita trabajar. 
Maria Irene en busca de que su negocio crezca, requiere de la compra de productos como granos, cervezas, y demás productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos. Sin embargo, Maria Irene no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de los productos como granos, cervezas, y demás productos de la canasta familiar, para que su negocio siga creciendo y pueda generarle mayores ingresos.
Maria Irene espera que su negocio le genere grandes ingresos y pueda así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo, brindándole un futuro económico estable y una actividad en la que pueda encontrar una oferta laboral.
texts.en:
Maria Irene is a person who is known to be very kind and very focused on her business. She expresses that, for her, the most important thing is to provide well-being to other people and to try to help others when in the position to do so. Maria Irene works in her general store, which she has had for approximately eight years. Thanks to this, she has earned enough income to cover the costs of the home she lives in with her son.

Maria Irene dreams of her business becoming well established in her town to increase sales and to be able to improve her quality of life. In addition, she wants her business to grow and one day become a mini-market which will create many jobs and allow her to continue supporting herself once her health fails and she can no longer work.

Maria Irene is looking to grow her business, which requires the purchase of items such as grain, beer, and other household products in order to offer her customers greater variety. However, she does not have enough capital to do this so she hopes a loan will give her the opportunity to purchase these products so that her business can continue to grow and she can increase revenues.

Maria Irene hopes her business will increase revenues and allow a higher quality of life for her son, providing him a stable economic future and the position to find a job.

loans.use: to buy items such as grain, beer, and other household products for her general store.

loans.name: Lhon

texts.en:
Lhon has been a taxi driver for the past three years in Iraq. This is a great business considering the streets in his city are colorful from the many yellow and white taxis, yet they are so much in demand it is often difficult to find an available one.

Lhon is married and has three children. With a previous loan from Relief International-Iraq, he was able to purchase a better car to provide better services for his customers. After successful repayment of this loan, he now took a loan of $3,000 USD from RI-Iraq to have the necessary capital to ensure proper maintenance for the car. 

In the future, he hopes to grow the business and hire an employee to better serve his customers.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to ensure proper maintenance for his car

loans.name: Hector Adonis

texts.es: Héctor Adonis tiene 35 años de edad, es un emprendedor que inicio su propio negocio de venta de medicamentos de forma ambulante, este negocio lo emprende por la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia. Sus clientes que le compran su producto saben la calidad de producto que les ofrece. Héctor  está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en el negocio en la compra de variedad de medicamentos que más consumen sus clientes.
texts.en: Héctor Adonis, 35, is an entrepreneur that began his own business selling medicines door to door.  He launched this business to earn income for his family. His customers know that the products he offers are of high quality. Héctor is applying for a loan to be able to invest in his business to purchase a variety of medicines that his customers consume most.

loans.use: to buy a variety of medicines.

loans.name: Waked

texts.en:
Waked is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s the one taking care of his family and covering his children’s educational costs. 

Waked has owned a coffee shop since 2003 in his town. People meet at his place to enjoy their time with friends. Today, he wants to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added products for his shop, such as charcoal, coffee and many other items. This will surely increase his sales and allow him to attract added customers. In the future, he plans to open a snack shop just next to his coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase added products for his shop, such as charcoal, coffee and many other items.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Arsenia tiene 66 años de edad, es casada, tiene hijos, quienes ya son todos mayores de edad. La Sra. Arsenia se dedica a la venta de bebidas, comestibles, hielo y además ropas en su Despensa, Copetín y Mercería hace aproximadamente 12 años. Se inicio con un pequeño Copetín, con el correr de los años incorporó al mismo la venta de ropas y actualmente la venta de hielo para diversos vendedores ambulantes de la ciudad de Asunción.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de variedad de bebidas, cervezas, gaseosas, vino, comestibles y una conservadora móvil para transporte de hielo. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en:
Arsenia is 66 years old, married and has children, all of whom have grown up. 

Arsenia has been selling drinks, snacks, ice and also clothes in her store, fast food counter and sewing supply store for around 12 years. She began with a small fast food counter and over the years has incorporated clothes sales into it and now also sells ice to various travelling salesman in the city of Asunción.

She is asking for this loan to buy a variety of drinks, beer, soda, wine, snacks and a mobile freezer to transport the ice. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, wine, snacks and a mobile freezer.

loans.name: Luis Pablo

texts.es:
Luis Pablo vive en Ica ,ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agroexporaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta pasear y viajar;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le agrada es la “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Luis Pablo tiene estudios Técnicos pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.
Luis es conviviente, y su pareja se dedica a la recolección de materiales reciclables, juntos tienen 2 hijos, los cuales actualmente cursan el nivel secundario. 

Luis es Chofer, transporta pasajeros diariamente alrededor de la ciudad de Ica, se dedica a este trabajo aproximadamente 12 horas diarias, el se animo a desarrollar esta actividad debido a la necesidad de transporte de las personas de su comunidad, en un día Luis Pablo puede transporta un promedio de veinte clientes de manera fija y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 90 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 120 soles, lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, el cree que su negocio tiene éxito porque realiza su labor de manera responsable y con honradez, además de tener un trato amable con los pasajeros. 

Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlo a obtener fondos para dar mantenimiento a su carro, que es su principal herramienta de trabajo, el desea poder pagar en 12 meses el total de su crédito. Esta mejora podrá ayudarle en su labor diaria teniendo en mejor estado su vehículo y ofreciendo seguridad  para los clientes y así poder en algunos meses comprar otro carro, lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener tres carros para así tener más ingresos para su hogar."
texts.en:
Luis Pablo lives in the city of Ica which is known for the increase in investments, not only in agroexports but also in new shopping centers that provide work for the local native population.  In his free time he enjoys taking walks and traveling.  As everyone knows, Perú is known for its delicious food and one of the dishes that he especially likes is "Carapulcra con sopa seca" (spicy Incan period cuisine).  Luis Pablo received a technical education but would like to have studied law.  He lives with his common-law wife who collects recyclable materials.  They have two children who are in high school.

Luis is a taxi driver who works approximately 12 hours a day in the city of Ica.  He decided to go into this business because of the need for transporation in his community.  He averages 20 customers per day which provides an average income of 90 PEN a day.  On a good day he can earn as much as 120 PEN a day, which helps cover additional household expenses.  He believes the business is successful because he is responsible and honest and is also kind to the passengers.

He hopes Kiva lenders can help him provide maintenance for his vehicle, which is his main work tool.  He wants to pay back the loan over a 12-month period.  This support will mean he can keep his vehicle in good running condition and provide safety for customers.  He wants to buy another car in a few months so he can realize his dream: "to have three cars to increase income for the household".

loans.use: To provide maintenance for his taxi.

loans.name: John Y.

texts.en:
John is from Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. He is a local entrepreneur who has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 1,400,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, John will be able to expand his business, make more sales and consequently improve his living conditions. 

The 40-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have three children who are attending primary schools. John has been a businessman for many years now: he sells soft drinks, milk, toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, etc. With this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, etc. wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is 37 years old and lives in Duanguican, Tudela. She is married with three children. Ginalyn has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 13 years. Ginalyn has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, beverages, detergents, etc. Ginalyn has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 33 years old and lives in P-3 Gango, Ozamiz City.  She is married with 1 school-age child.
